title: Yardage
content:

  Image: 

  object_work_type: textiles (visual works) yardage

  title_text: Yardage

  preference: main

  title_language: English

  creation_date: 20th century

  creation_place_original_location: Rajasthan (India)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: rectangular

  materials_name: wool (textile) cotton (textile)

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique)

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a piece of fabric. It features a plaid pattern
 with multicolored embroidery along the bottom hem to create repeated triangular scrolls. The left end of the yardage is laid out
 while the rest of the length of the fabric is collected on the right.

  subject_terms_1: cloth plaid (pattern) embroidery (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Plaid Embroidery Textile fabrics Bishnois

  subject_terms_3: Textile art and design Indian costumes

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This yardage would have been stitched into a skirt
 worn by women of the Bishnoi community of Rajasthan. The handwoven material is made of cotton
 and embroidered in bright wool
